Articles.Content:
A rant....

So, I build a lifting stage (Asparagus, of course), that can get 200 tons and change into 75km orbit, no problems.

(Ok, so I boast. Pretty proud of it, although it is rather simple in design)

And now I am too lazy to build a smaller one. I just use it for everything. Well... almost everything.

80 tons? So what? Use the big one. Lots of fuel left over, but what the hell.....

I can't wait till costs are somehow a factor in a future update.

This update taught me to build with limited parts.... the next (or one of the next) will hopefully teach me to be efficient.

;-)

What if all that fuel crashes into your station?

What if it orbit decays and falls on a school full of kerbals?

Who would be laughing then?

Nobody, because kerbin would explode...

Why would you do this?

You lazy person.....no care for others

I personally like to have a lifter for each Fuel tank. That is, my heaviest lifter only gets 36 tons to orbit.

Grats on being too good at the game
First time anyone has ever been able to spell efficiency right and then get disaster wrong in the same topic.

First time anyone has ever been able to spell efficiency right and then get disaster wrong in the same topic.

Wups. Ok, so I would like to add that english is not my first language, ok? And "Efficiency" I checked with the spellchecker. I thought I had no trouble with "disaster", so I didn't check. Well.... Call me legasthenic. Which coincidentally, I am. Kind of. Got some schooling as a child.

Grats on being too good at the game

Thanks, but it is not that hard.

Since it's asparagus you can make it smaller simply by removing the outer stage.
